poem:
### The Mirage of Peace

In the land of the free,  
a shadow stretches,  
an empire's reach  
into dust and oil.  
Promises featherlight,  
aloft in the winds  
of ambition's gale.  
MAGA whispers,  
stillness broken—  
iron birds gather.  
The peace promised  
a mirage,  
drifting on volatile air.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Why is Trump, the self-proclaimed ‘president of peace’, aiming to topple the Venezuelan regime? It was a solemn pledge at the heart of Donald Trump’s “America first” appeal. A “Make America great again” (Maga) foreign policy would mean the end of military commitments that had in the past sucked the US into draining and drawn-out wars far from its own shores. Now an intense military buildup targeting the authoritarian regime of Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
